description: 6 persons are crushed to death and 7th is trapped and feared dead when roof of Fed office bldg in Miami, Fla, collapses; illus (M)
title: Office Building Roof Collapses in Miami
title_page: Office Building Roof Collapses in Miami - The New York Times
maintext:
MIAMI, Aug. 5 (AP)—Six persons were crushed to death and a seventh was trapped and feared dead today when the roof of a Federal office building in downtown Miami collapsed sending tons of concrete and several parked cars crashing through the offices below.
The bodies of three women were recovered and policemen and firemen said they had seen three other bodies buried beneath the debris. A spokesman for the Drug Enforcement Administration said it would take hours to reach them.
Nearly nine hours after the building collapsed, workers reached the first body, identifed as that of Ann Pope, a 55‐year‐old cashier from Fort Lauderdale. The body of another woman pulled from the wreckage was identified as that of Anna Y. Mounger, 24, a clerk‐typist from Miami.
The identity of, the third recovered body was not immediately known.
Another victim was identified as Charles H. Mann a special agent. His body had not been recovered.
